result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas C. Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 15CF258 and any other sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/schooling and when not fully engaged, must complete 15 hours of community service per week.

Counseling as recommended. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas C. Davis

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case called: 2:42 pm
Includes 15CF258 and 15CM531.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Suzanne O'Neill;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
15CF258:
Ct. 1 (Identity Theft-Financial Gain)>>Dismiss the Repeater Enhancer. 
Ct. 2 (Identity Theft-Financial Gain-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (Theft-Movable Property-Repeater)>>DRI.

15CM531:
Ct. 1 (Theft-Movable Property-Repeater)>>Dismiss the Repeater Enhancer.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
15CF258:
Ct. 1 (Identity Theft-Financial Gain)>>NO CONTEST.

15CM531:
Ct. 1 (Theft-Movable Property)>>NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
15CF258:
Ct. 1 (Identity Theft-Financial Gain)>> Sentence W/H- 3 years probation, Concurrent to each other and any other sentence being currently served and any conditional time. CONDITIONS: 6 months MCJ w/Huber for work/school/treatment or a combination, counseling as recommended, Good effort to maintain Full time Work/Full time school and when not fully engaged must complete 15 hours of Community Service a week, Court Costs. COURT finds 89 days jail credit.

15CM531:
Ct. 1 (Theft-Movable Property)>> Sentence W/H- 1 year probation, Concurrent to each other and any other sentence being currently served and any conditional time. CONDITIONS: Counseling as recommended, Good effort to maintain Full time Work/Full time school and when not fully engaged must complete 15 hours of Community Service a week, Court Costs. COURT finds 89 days jail credit. 

Adjourned: 2:53 pm

(for Judge Moran)
ad Prosequendum
dft, Plea/Sentencing Hearing 6/4/15

Court ordered $1,000.00 sig. bond on 4-27-15/Rel.
Original warrant returned from Sheriff's Dept.

INCLUDES 15CM531 & 15CF258 No contact with victim(s): American Choice Meats (15CM531 & T.W., Trigs, & County Market (15CF258). Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
